Olive oil is an item used in the Shades of Mort'ton minigame. It may be purchased from Razmire's general store in Mort'ton for 28 coins or from Rasolo the wandering merchant for 40 coins. It is also sometimes received from giving Serum 207 or Serum 208 to the Afflicted found wandering in the town.

To create sacred oil, an item used in the preparation of pyre logs, players must first help to restore the Temple of Mort'ton that lies to the north-east of the town. Restoration also earns points. Once the temple is rebuilt, players may light the altar in the centre of the temple and use their olive oil on the fire. This converts the ordinary olive oil into sacred oil, consuming sanctity. Each 4 dose item, when sanctified, consumes 3.6% sanctity, but requires at least 10% to sanctify.

15 April 2016
(update)

Half full potions could now be turned into bank placeholders.

20 November 2014
(update | poll)

Olive Oil packs are added to the game.

17 May 2005
(update)
  • An "Empty" option was added.
  • The item's examine was changed from "n doses of olive oil"[sic] to "n doses of olive oil."

'''Olive oil''' is an item used in the [[Shades of Mort'ton (minigame)|Shades of Mort'ton]] [[minigame]]. It may be purchased from [[Razmire]]'s general store in [[Mort'ton]] for 28 coins or from [[Rasolo]] the wandering merchant for 40 coins. It is also sometimes received from giving [[Serum 207]] or [[Serum 208]] to the [[Afflicted]] found wandering in the town.

To create [[sacred oil]], an item used in the preparation of [[pyre logs]], players must first help to restore the [[Temple of Mort'ton]] that lies to the north-east of the town. Restoration also earns points. Once the temple is rebuilt, players may light the altar in the centre of the temple and use their olive oil on the fire. This converts the ordinary olive oil into [[sacred oil]], consuming sanctity. Each 4 dose item, when sanctified, consumes 3.6% sanctity, but requires at least 10% to sanctify.
